meanings.definition: The tendency of an atom to attract a shared pair of electrons in a chemical bond.
meanings.sent1: The electronegativity of oxygen makes it highly reactive in forming bonds.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use electronegativity values to predict how atoms will combine in molecules.
meanings.sent3: When hydrogen and oxygen argue over electronegativity, it leads to explosive chemistry jokes.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of chemical bonding, electronegativity is the partner that always leads.
meanings.sent5: Picture electronegativity as a magnet pulling electrons towards itself in a bond.

meanings.definition: A measure of the ability of an atom to attract electrons in a chemical compound.
meanings.sent1: Understanding electronegativity helps in determining the reactivity of elements.
meanings.sent2: The concept of electronegativity is crucial in explaining the behavior of molecules.
meanings.sent3: When carbon's electronegativity goes on vacation, chaos breaks loose in the molecule party.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of atoms, electronegativity is the silent force that shapes chemical destinies.
meanings.sent5: Imagine electronegativity as a powerful magnet drawing electrons towards its atomic embrace.
